Status d_status

Detailed Description

Overall management of Robotic Platform programs.

The class RoboticPlatform contains all global functions of the RoboticPlatform. This includes command line options and configuration management.

The class RoboticPlatform only contains static data members and functions. For simplicity, the "s_" prefix is omitted for the static member functions. The member functions can be either used with the class scope "RoboticPlatform::..." or by first creating an object of class RoboticPlatform and then using the member function with that object: 

 RoboticPlatform::setSimulationModeOn();
or 
 RoboticPlatform rp;
 rp.setSimulationModeOn();

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package: Core Classes
// Authors: Markus Loffler
// Start Date: Tue Feb 06 09:31:06 est 2001
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: RoboticPlatform.t.cpp
// Example program for the class RoboticPlatform.
//========================================================================  
 

// ----- Standard Libaries -----
#include <iostream.h>

// ----- QRTS Libraries -----

// ----- Project Includes -----
#include "RoboticPlatform.hpp"

 
 
//======================================================================== 
// showConfiguration
//========================================================================  
 
void showConfiguration()
{ 
  RoboticPlatform rp;
  
  cout << "Current Configuration:" << endl;
  
  cout << "Global Configuration File: "
       << RoboticPlatform::getGlobalConfigurationFileName() << endl;
       
  cout << "Simulation Mode            ";
  if (rp.isSimulationModeSetFromConfig())
    cout << "set from configuration" << endl;
  else
  {
    if (rp.isSimulationModeOn())
      cout << "on" << endl;
    else
      cout << "off" << endl;
  }
    
  cout << "Start Scene Viewer         ";
  if (rp.isStartSceneViewerOn())
    cout << "on" << endl;
  else
    cout << "off" << endl;

  cout << endl;
}


//======================================================================== 
// main
//========================================================================  
 
int main(int argc, char *argv[])
{
  RoboticPlatform::init(argc, argv);
  if (RoboticPlatform::d_status.isStatusError())
  {
    cout << RoboticPlatform::d_status.getMessageText() << endl;
    RoboticPlatform::d_status.setStatusOk();
    return -1;
  }

  showConfiguration();
    
  RoboticPlatform::setSimulationModeOff();
  RoboticPlatform::setStartSceneViewerOff();
  
  showConfiguration();
    
  RoboticPlatform::exit();
  return 0;
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

RoboticPlatform ( )
 

The constructor performs no action.

~RoboticPlatform ( )
 

The destructor performs no action.

Member Function Documentation

void init ( int argc,
char * argv[] ) [static]
 

Initializes the Robotic Platform. If there is an error, the d_status member of this class will be set. The command line parameters are parsed as follows:

  • -sim : Enables the simulation mode for all objects. Default: Set simulation mode according to the global configuration file. If it is not specified in the global configuration file, use simulation mode by default. Equivalent: setSimulationModeOn().
  • -hw : Disables the simulation mode for all objects. Default: Set simulation mode according to the global configuration file. If it is not specified in the global configuration file, use simulation mode by default. Equivalent: setSimulationModeOff().
  • -view : Enables the automatic startup of the Scene Viewer (default). Equivalent: setStartSceneViewerOn().
  • -noview : Disables the automatic startup of the Scene Viewer Equivalent: setStartSceneViewerOff().
  • -config <configName> : Specifies the global configuration file (default: rp.cfg). Equivalent: setGlobalConfigurationFileName().
  • -errorexit : Enables the automatic error exit. If this setting is enabled, the program automatically terminates in case of an error, even if the programmer does not explicitily check the status. (default). Equivalent: setErrorExitOn().
  • -noerrorexit : Disables the automatic error exit. The programmer has to call exit() explicitly to exit the program in case of error.
  • -qmotor <objectName> : Start the QMotor GUI for a certain control loop. The control loop is specified by the parameter <objectName>. There are three options:
    1. <objectName> is not specified. The first QMotor control loop is used.
    2. <objectName> is specified. The control loop of the object with that name is used.
    3. <objectName> is set to "select". The framework will ask for each control loop wheather to start the GUI.

void init ( ) [static]
 

Initializes the Robotic Platform with default parameters. These are:

  • Simulation mode is set according to the global configuration file.
  • Automatic startup of the Scene Viewer is enabled.
  • The default configuration file is used.
  • Automatic error exit is enabled.

void exit ( ) [static]
 

Terminates the program. If the status d_status is set to error, and error message is displayed on the screen. The system is shutdown. If exit() is not called from the main() thread, it will return and signal the main thread to exit.

void setExitBarrier ( Barrier * exitBarrier ) [static]
 

Sets an exit barrier. At program exit, the framework will wait at this barrier before shutting down all the objects. Default: 0 (don't wait for the barrier).

Parameters:
exitBarrier   The exit barrier.

Barrier * getExitBarrier ( ) [static]
 

Gets the exit barrier.

Returns:
The exit barrier.

void setExitOnlyWhenAllWindowsClosedOn ( ) [static]
 

In this mode, the framework waits at the end of a robot control program until the user closes all GUI windows before shutting down and exiting the program.

void setExitOnlyWhenAllWindowsClosedOff ( ) [static]
 

In this mode, the framework exits a robot control program immediately and closes all GUI windows.

bool isExitOnlyWhenAllWindowsClosedOn ( ) [static]
 

Determines if the framework waits at the end of a robot control program until all GUI windows are closed.

Parameters:
true:   Framework waits for windows to be closed by the user,
false:   Framework does not wait and closes windows.

void setSimulationModeFromConfig ( ) [static]
 

In this mode, the global configuration file specifies the simulation mode for all objects created from now on (default). Note: A call to init() might override this mode.

bool isSimulationModeSetFromConfig ( ) [static]
 

Returns if the simulation mode is set according to the global configuration file.

Returns:
true: The simulation mode is set according to the global configuration file, false: There is a different settting enabled.

void setSimulationModeOn ( ) [static]
 

Enables the simulation mode for all objects. All objects created from that point on will use the simulation mode. Default: setSimulationModeFromConfig(); Note: A call to init() might override this mode.

bool isSimulationModeOn ( ) [static]
 

Returns if the simulation mode is on for all objects created from now on.

Returns:
true: The simulation mode is on, false: There is a different settting enabled.

void setSimulationModeOff ( ) [static]
 

Disables the simulation mode for all objects. All objects created from that point on will use the simulation mode. Default: setSimulationModeFromConfig(); Note: A call to init() might override this mode.

bool isSimulationModeOff ( ) [static]
 

Returns if the simulation mode is off for all objects created from now on.

Returns:
true: The simulation mode is off, false: There is a different settting enabled.

void setStartSceneViewerOn ( ) [static]
 

Enables the startup of the Scene Viewer at the call of start(). Note: A call to init() might override this mode.

void setStartSceneViewerOff ( ) [static]
 

Disables the startup of the Scene Viewer at the call of start(). Note: A call to init() might override this mode.

bool isStartSceneViewerOn ( ) [static]
 

Determines if the Scene Viewer will be started at the call of start().

Returns:
true: The Scene Viewer will be started false: The Scene Viewer won't be started

void setErrorExitOn ( ) [static]
 

Enables the automatic exit of the program in case of a fatal error. This is the default. By using this feature, the programmer does not need to check the status. In case of an error, the system will shut down and exit the program.

void setErrorExitOff ( ) [static]
 

Disables the automatic exit of the program in case of a fatal error. When the automatic error exit is disabled, the programmer should check the status after operations regularly.

int isErrorExitOn ( ) [static]
 

Determines if automatic error exit is enabled.

Returns:
true: Automatic error exit is enabled, false: Automatic error exit is disabled.

PhImage_t * getIcon ( const char * iconName ) [static]
 

This function loads the image file with the name <iconName>.gif. If the image is already loaded, just a pointer to the already existing image is returned. The search path for images is defined by the shell variable RP_IMAGE_PATH. The user does not need to be concerned with freeing the image's memory.

Parameters:
iconName   The name of the icon. Class icons usually have the same name as the class name, for small class icons it is <ClassName>_small.
Returns:
A pointer to the class image, 0 in case of error.

void lockPhoton ( ) [static]
 

Calls this function before doing any Photon or QWidgets++ programming. This ensures thread-safety. You must call unlockPhoton() when finished accessing Photon.

Example: 

     RoboticPlatform::lockPhoton();
     d_button = new CButton(d_controlPanelGroup, "My Button");
     RoboticPlatform::unlockPhoton();

void unlockPhoton ( ) [static]
 

Call this function when done accessing Photon functionality.

void setGuiInitFunction ( void(* initFunction)(void) ) [static]
 

Sets a function that is called when the GUI is initialized in the other thread. A user defined GUI can be started in this function. The advantage is that the user defined GUI will be started in the main GUI thread, and calls to RoboticPlatform::lockPhoton() and RoboticPlatform::unlockPhoton() are not necessary. You must call this function before RoboticPlatform::init().

Parameters:
initFunction   This function will be called from the GUI thread.

void setGUIUpdateOn ( ) [static]
 

Enables the continuous update of the GUI, i.e., the update of the Scene Viewer, the control panels, etc. This is enabled by default.

void setGUIUpdateOff ( ) [static]
 

Disables the continuous update of the GUI, i.e., the update of the Scene Viewer, the control panels, etc. This function must be used before opening e.g. fileselect dialogs, since the continuous GUI update might starve the fileselect dialog.

bool isGUIUpdateOn ( ) [static]
 

Determines if the continous update of the GUI is currently enabled.

Returns:
true: The GUI update is enabled, false: The GUI update is disabled.

string convertLengthToString ( double length,
bool displayUnit = false ) [static]
 

Converts a length value to a string, using the selected unit.

Parameters:
length   The length in meters.
displayUnit   If true, displays the unit after the number.

string convertAngleToString ( double angle,
bool displayUnit = false ) [static]
 

Converts an angle value to a string, using the selected unit.

Parameters:
displayUnit   If true, displays the unit after the number.
angle   The angle in radians.

const char * getLengthUnitName ( ) [static]
 

Determines the name of the unit used to display lengths.

Returns:
The name of the length unit.

const char * getAngleUnitName ( ) [static]
 

Determines the name of the unit used to display angles.

Returns:
The name of the angle unit.

void setGlobalConfigurationFile ( const char * fileName ) [static]
 

Sets the name of the global configuration file (Default: rp.cfg). If a path is included in fileName, this path will be used. If no path is included, the Robotic Platform will use the variable RP_CONFIG_PATH to find the configuration file. After the name is set, the configuration is loaded. Note: A call to init() might override this setting.

Parameters:
fileName   The filename of the global configuration file.

const char * getGlobalConfigurationFileName ( ) [static]
 

Returns the filename of the current global configuration file.

Returns:
The filename of the global configuration file

void lockGlobalConfiguration ( ) [static]
 

Call this function every time you access the global configuration. It will block if another thread is currently accessing the global configuration. Otherwise other threads will be blocked until you call unlockGlobalConfiguration();

void unlockGlobalConfiguration ( ) [static]
 

Unlocks the global configuration.

Config * getGlobalConfiguration ( ) [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the global configuration.

Returns:
A pointer to the global configuration.

CmdLineArgs * getCommandLineArguments ( ) [static]
 

Returns a pointer to the command line arguments that were passed to init().

Returns:
A pointer to the command line arguments

void shutdown ( ) [static]
 

Shutsdown the entire system. This function loops through all objects, instructs them to shut down and waits until the shutdown is complete. This function is automatically called at program termination. This function, however, won't terminate the program.

bool isSystemShuttingDown ( ) [static]
 

Determines if the Robotic Platform currently performs the system shutdown.

Returns:
true: System shutdown is in progress, false: Normal operation.

Member Data Documentation

Status d_status [static]
 

The status of the Robotic Platform.
